intro: Cymbostemon parviflorus, commonly known as the small-flowered cymbostemon, is a member of the Boraginaceae family. It is a shrub native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. The plant features narrow, lance-shaped leaves and produces clusters of small, pale blue or purple flowers. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, often found in arid and semi-arid environments. The flowers are typically visited by bees and other pollinators, contributing to its ecological significance.
